conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on hemispheres A and B.
Hemispheres A and B are between vertical walls with a 30° angle between them.
Identify forces on hemisphere A: weight, normal force from wall, frictional force from wall, normal force from B, frictional force from B.
Identify forces on hemisphere B: weight, normal force from A, frictional force from A.
For hemisphere A, horizontal direction: \(N_A = N_{AB} \cos(30°)\).
For hemisphere A, vertical direction: \(W_A + f_A = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + N_A\).
For hemisphere B, horizontal direction: \(N_{BA} = N_{AB}\).
For hemisphere B, vertical direction: \(W_B = N_{BA} \sin(30°) + f_{BA}\).
Frictional forces are at maximum, equal to sliding friction force.
From vertical direction for A: \(m \cdot g + \mu N_A = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + N_A\).
From horizontal direction for A: \(N_A = N_{AB} \cos(30°)\).
Substitute \(N_A\) into vertical equation for A: \(m \cdot g + \mu N_{AB} \cos(30°) = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + N_{AB} \cos(30°)\).
From vertical direction for B: \(2m \cdot g = N_{AB} \sin(30°) + \mu N_{AB}\).
Substitute \(N_{AB}\) into equation for A: \(m \cdot g = \frac{2m \cdot g}{\sin(30°) + \mu} (\sin(30°) + \cos(30°) - \mu \cos(30°))\).
